metadata.Title: CVE-2018-4119 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 11.3 is affected. Safari before 11.1 is affected. iCloud before 7.4 on Windows is affected. iTunes before 12.7.4 on Windows is affected. tvOS before 11.3 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. It allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via a crafted web site.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-4119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.20.0-2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.20.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.20.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.20.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.20.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.20.0-2
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.20.0-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.20.0-2').
